text: terror in the heart of Tunis just meters
from Parliament in the middle of the day
people scramble for safety as militants
take over the nearby Bardo Museum
Tunisian security forces cover the
museum with their guns as individuals
cowered inside back on the street one
family tried to find safety inside the
museum what looks like the beginning of
a hostage taking amongst the wounded
three from Poland and two Italians what
could have turned a tragedy into a
drawn-out disaster a prolonged hostage
taking was ended by the Tunisian
security forces their strike at the
museum killed two militants left one
officer dead visitors to the museum were
led in relative calm to safety and
freedom but the Tunisian Prime Minister
has warned that two or three gunmen may
still be at large
Tunisia has escaped the chaos that
followed much of the Arab Spring but it
is not immune to the terror sweeping the
region Johnny diamond BBC news
